big.process1D.spline
Class Bspline

java.lang.Object
  big.process1D.spline.Bspline

public class Bspline
extends java.lang.Object

This class deals with polynomial B-splines.

Method Detail

binomial

public static double binomial(int n,
                              int k)
Returns the value of the binomial coefficient evaluated at the given arguments. Mathematically, we have that
∀ n ∈ ℕ, ∀ k ∈ ℕ, k ≤ n: Binomial[n, k] = n! ∕ ((n - k)! k!).

Parameters:
n - the larger argument.
k - the smaller argument.
Returns:
the binomial coefficient.

bspline

public static double bspline(double x,
                             int splineDegree)
Returns the value of a B-spline of given degree evaluated at the given argument. Mathematically, if the degree is n, then the B-spline is written βn and is given by
∀ n ∈ ℕ, ∀ x ∈ ℝ: βn(x) = ∑k ∈ [0…n + 1] (-1)k Binomial(n + 1, k) ςn(x + (n + 1) ∕ 2 - k),
where ςn is a polynomial simple element.

Parameters:
x - the argument.
splineDegree - the nonnegative degree of the B-spline.
Returns:
the value of the B-spline.
See Also:
binomial(int, int), polynomialSimpleElement(double, int)

bsplineFirstOrderDerivative

public static double bsplineFirstOrderDerivative(double x,
                                                 int splineDegree)
Returns the value of the first-order derivative of a B-spline of given degree evaluated at the given argument. Mathematically, if the degree is n, then the first derivative of a B-spline is written dβn(x) ∕ dx and is given by
∀ n ∈ ℕ, ∀ x ∈ ℝ: dβn(x) ∕ dx = ∑k ∈ [0…n + 1] (-1)k Binomial(n + 1, k) ςn - 1(x + (n + 1) ∕ 2 - k),
where ςn is a polynomial simple element. The value of dβ0(x) ∕ dx is not numeric for x ∈ {-½, ½}; it is 0 otherwise.

Parameters:
x - the argument.
splineDegree - the nonnegative degree of the B-spline.
Returns:
the value of the B-spline first-order derivative.
See Also:
binomial(int, int), polynomialSimpleElement(double, int)

factorial

public static double factorial(int n)
Returns the value of the factorial of the given arguments.

Parameters:
n - the argument.
Returns:
the facorial.

getBsplineFilter

public static EvenSymmetricFIRFilter getBsplineFilter(int splineDegree)
Returns an EvenSymmetricFIRFilter object that contains the sequence of coefficients bn[k] = βn(k) for k ∈ [0…⌊n ∕ 2⌋] when the degree n of the B-spline is not smaller than 2, and the identity when n ∈ {0, 1}.

Parameters:
splineDegree - the nonnegative degree of the B-spline.
Returns:
the truncated inverse B-spline filter.
See Also:
EvenSymmetricFIRFilter

getTruncatedInverseBsplineFilter

public static EvenSymmetricFIRFilter getTruncatedInverseBsplineFilter(int filterLength,
                                                                      int splineDegree)
Returns an EvenSymmetricFIRFilter object that contains the truncated sequence of coefficients (bn)-1[k] for k ∈ [0…n - 1], where n is the nonnegative degree of the B-spline.

Parameters:
filterLength - the number of elements of the causal part of the filter.
splineDegree - the nonnegative degree of the B-spline.
Returns:
the truncated inverse B-spline filter.
See Also:
EvenSymmetricFIRFilter

polynomialSimpleElement

public static double polynomialSimpleElement(double x,
                                             int splineDegree)
Returns the value of a polynomial simple element of given degree evaluated at the given argument. Mathematically, if the degree is n, then the polynomial simple element is written ςn and is given by
∀ n ∈ ℕ, ∀ x ∈ ℝ: ςn(x) = ½ sgn(x) xn ∕ n!
where sgn(x) = x ∕ |x|, and sgn(0) = 0.

Parameters:
x - the argument where to evaluate the B-spline.
splineDegree - the nonnegative degree of the B-spline.
Returns:
the value of the polynomial simple element.
